Replies.Reply: Paint peeling off the rusty bars. Somewhere, someone is playing harmonica. Prisoners yell complaints as he passes.
Shut up, convict! Get yer hands off the bars!
Hey, Yaz! You got a visitor.
You can't win. You've only got one shot in there!
Hey! Whoa! What are you doing?
Big surprise, you win every year.
Move and it's the last thing you do!
Sir, this is unit 3 bravo -- we have an attempted perimeter breach into mission control subhallway Charlie. One caucasian, one negroid, four... other. Yes, sir.
Shut up! Anything you have to say, you can say to my superior officer!
Lt. Colonel! Here are the intruders, sir!
Sir?
Yes, sir...
Should we radio the Colonel?
You wanna get yelled at again?
Go ahead.
The lazy-ass guards in charge of screening visitors read magazines, watch TV. Footsteps -- someone's here. Which pisses them off, because that means they actually have to do their jobs.

Going through the metal detectors, waved over with security wands. The guards are being thorough. Maybe more thorough than they need to be. They check everything -- even the cake. The digital readout tells them NO METAL DETECTED.
Spare. Just a table and chairs in the middle -- poured concrete. Nothing a convict could, say, smash into the face of a guard.
huge mane of hair, a big handlebar moustache that frames a grubby unshaven face...
When's the last time you conjugated anything?
Thanks, darling.
Hey could you cut this up for us?
I wouldn't do that.
That's why.
There's nothing sexier than a girl killing for me.
I'm not just a man of brute force, you know. I prefer to be known for my rapier wit--
--and tongue.
You look hot. Mind if I open a window?
I'm coming for you...
Some things are worth waiting for.
This time you don't have your friends to tell you what happens next.
All I wanted was justice, Kay.
Why don't you say that to their faces when you see them...
Can you help a stranger, please?
There's been a great injustice in the Universe. I must make it right.
Let me ease your pain.
Excuse me, officers of the law.
Have you ever lost someone close to you? I have. I've lost everyone.
Where did you go...
I want in.
You can't stop me! Nothing on Earth can stop me!
Try it! You wouldn't dare! One false shot and you'll rip space and time!
I brought you a cake.
You got so strong in prison.
You okay, baby? Momma's got you.
Not for me.
But in a flash, the mouth SPRINGS OUT -- IT BELONGS TO A VORACIOUS ALIEN -- another springs out behind it -- they consume the guard's entire face.
Prisoners go nuts, guards scramble -- smoke, screaming, chaos.
Give it up, Yaz! There's no way out!
As he and Devil girl step through the hole, take a deep, satisfied breath of FREEDOM.
MiB credits fly us through the Galaxy.
Rotating on a spit.
That? That nasty, greasy thing makes your life worth living?
The tanks in the back, Wu.
Hey, save the chop socky bullshit for the locals, Wu. We need to see the kitchen.
Why are you busting my balls, Jay?
Wow, I didn't think there was anything uglier than a catfish.

Look, Wu. You can serve it to your... out of town guests, but locals get earth fish. REAL earth fish. The kind that doesn't jump out of their stomach and get everyone asking a lot of annoying questions. Like, "Why is my lunch eating Daddy?" You got it?
DAMN, that's ugly.
Something about this strike you as weird?
Look at table two over there. They haven't ordered a thing. When's the last time Wu let someone sit at a table without ordering? And table five over there just drank his third cup of duck sauce.
Because it's about to go down.
You probably took that whole catfish thing the wrong way --
I was jealous, you know? Because you're so pretty!
Kay! KAY!!! Little help! Little help!
So I was thinking about making a chart for each time I save your ass. And when I do it ten times, you buy me lunch.
We're gonna need a cleanup on the corner of Canal and Mott. And bring a net. Biggest one you've got.
Why aren't you eating?
So what the hell was that guy?
Why? Was he the wrong guy?
Yeah, well, don't worry, I think I took care of him.
I make it look easy. That's the problem with being my partner.
You get used to my game. It's what Dr. Phil would call taking for granted.
What does an MiB agent call it when 12 alien species try to kill him?
Seriously, man, those noodles'll kill you before he does. I got your back.
Oh, yeah? I used to play a game with my dad, too. Called catch.
Hard to badmouth someone you don't know.
Alright, forget it. The past is the past. And right now we have something much more important to talk about. Bowling Night.
Tired? What -- you afraid I'm gonna take that MVP trophy away from you?
Yaz... Yaz... Yaz... Where are you, Yaz...?
Here we go...
Alright, Bowling Robot, do what we built you for.
Guess it's on me.
Of course -- the one time Kay isn't here...
Check it out--
Look who's league MVP.
I... huh?
Where are you, Kay? I think you want to see this. It's the bowling MVP trophy with MY name on it.
Maybe you want to think twice next time you ditch me.
Kay?
Yeah, I just wanted to show you this so I could say--
Who the hell are YOU???
You new around here?
Yeah, okay, but I need the other Kay. You know, craggy old white guy... well, DIFFERENT craggy old white guy.
What the HELL is going on here?
How about instead, you go find me THIS guy?
Killed? In 1969?
Kay's dead? How? Why?
Whoa, what's everyone freaking out about? We had one of these last week.
Wait - what is everyone's problem?
Kay talked you out of it? Kay wouldn't do that. He's the most distrustful person in the galaxy.
Yeah, that's working out great.
Where the hell did he.get an iPhone in 1969?
Kay said Yaz can get you anywhere, anytime. Any TIME. So Yaz killed Kay in 1969 and now there's no missile shield.
You're definitely not Kay!
Where you going in such a hurry, Obadiah? The past?
I know you've been time-travelling.
Yeah? What's this?
What else you got here?
Oh, yeah?
Is that a dodo bird?
I think he'd be happier free.
Interesting.
And this?
Listen -- I'll look the other way if you tell me who's selling time travel these days. I just want your supplier.
Don't worry, he won't have time.
Those hit the sun in 8 minutes.
I just want a name.
Yeah, well, the thing about tomorrow is, we'll all be busy being dead.
Help me, or the world is gonna end.
Right. Take a look at this.
You start sharing the illegal time travel tech you've been slinging.
You only need seven minutes, get the cheap one.
Where is it??
Yes, but we're running out of time--
Oh, I see the problem.
That's it?
Okay, thanks.
Yeah, well, is it ok if I change  THAT?
Don't worry, I'll fix it. You'll only be dead for a little while.
Yeah.
Guess what? Black president!
Yeah, thanks, listen--
Yeah, guess I knew this wasn't gonna be just people handing me money and Cadillacs.
Nothing, officer. I'll be on my way.
Thanks.
Yeah, I'm the North American champion of kiss my ass.
Kay? Kay, is that you? Oh, man it's good to see you, buddy!
Look at you, all... sort-of-
Oh! You think -- aw,that's funny.
There's a simple explanation for that.
You see I'm your partner...
In the future. And I came back to save you.
Yeah, ok, I know it sounds a little-
That's why I'm going to prove it to you... Because if I weren't from the future, would I know about --
I said -- HERE?
Right. Not here yet. But it will be. Gonna need to get rid of the raccoons and bats and stuff, but...
Is this your favorite place? Makes.
So how old are you?
Really? Wow, you got some city miles on you.
The fourteenth. Then we have two days.
Hey, look, I know your lunch is important, but like I said, we only have two days here.
No way, man. I am not letting you eat that. I didn't come all the way here to have you die before I can tell you--
No way, man. No way the world ends because you had to eat that thing--
Don't worry, you guys get a big promotion in, like, 20 years.
What planet are they from?
Finally.
Oh, we're gonna do the forms now.
My name is Agent Jay, you gave it to me.
To save the Earth.
Fine, don't believe me. But just listen to what I have to say, because it's going to save your life and the life of everyone in this galaxy.
There's a killer out there. Goes by "Yaz." He's coming for you.
You will. Here's what to look for.
Man, you're as stubborn as you always were. I mean -- always will be. Look, It's not just about you.
So what's code 43?
Whoa, whoa, what? You're gonna neuralize ME? You can't neuralize me. Haven't you been listening?
You erase what's in here, you erase the whole world.
I don't need to calm down.
I AM a good agent!
That's right, you always lead with your left.
I know you, Kay, I can prove it...
You love to bowl!
You've got a scar on the back of your right hand!
Damn. You will! I swear!
Kay! KAY!!! What about your girl on Martha's Vineyard?
You chose the job over her -- but you never stopped thinking about her. You can't forget her.
You see, Kay? It's me--
Yeah, okay, um -- according to the file, he should have entered Earth-
Can I ask how you're planning on getting me out of here?
How's it going, fellas? Look, I put on my pants.
Aww. Did I spoil the mood?
Yeah, yeah. Window out of my head.
This doesn't look like a mob hit.
Spores. Dematerializing corpses.
Aren't you gonna give me a.gun?
You try not to get in MY way.
Stay behind me. You need to stay alive.
Huh. So that's how you got the scar.
What'd he look like?
Pull it together!
The guy who did this --- what'd he look like?
That's him.
Yeah.
Aw, this means you like me, doesn't it?
In two days he's gonna kill you in Florida.
Sorry, I was distracted by the Earth blowing up.
Alien Town?
There's gotta be something that connects you to Yaz. What cases are you working on?
Dry ice? What's that? Someone get killed over some dry ice?
Wow, you're pretty low on the totem pole, aren't you? The great Kay, looking for dry ice.
What - me?
We need to talk. Please.
We're looking for a recent arrival.
Hold up -- the guy we're looking for -- he's out to destroy the world.
I thought you made that up.
33 hours.
Just wondering where you got that.
Really. So my mother gave you a technology that hasn't been  INVENTED FOR SEVEN YEARS?
Now how about you tell me where you really got it?
Alright, one more time. Where'd you get this?
Bullshit.
Oh, hey. This is my partner. He's about to get fired for excessive violence and he doesn't have much left to lose.
That's what I like. A nice, honest thief. Stole it from who?
Who?
Archanans? They're pretty far out of their neighborhood. I didn't think we'd ever had one on Earth before.
I'll do a lot worse. Get the hell out of here.
You were wearing one just like it when you died. Come on.
So you come here tomorrow, get tangled up with these Archanans...
Something like that. So do me and the people of Earth a favor and be careful.
Hey, I've always got my big girl panties on.
Because I was the only kid on my block who didn't have one.
Didn't have a daddy to not buy me toys. Here's the only thing I ever got from him--
It gets worse. You're the closest thing I have to a dad.
That's from Yaz's ring. He was here. Or is here.
So Yaz was never after you... he was after the Archanans. You just got in the way.
'No sign of struggle. They must've cleared out before he got here.
Think this might tell us something?
How about bible verses?
Phone numbers!
Slow down -- who's after you?
Get in.
So where can we take you?
Are you sure? Seems dangerous.
What the hell was that?
Say that again!
No, the whole thing!
I know where they are!
How are we going to find them? Any idea what an Archanan looks like?
You're in danger--
Very cute, but--
Huh?
Thanks.
Take the bridge...
Only a matter of time before he comes back. And this time he might be really mad.
Damn, we lost them. They come all the way across the universe and just when we're about to figure out what all of this is about--
Everybody OK?
Yeah... guess I can't argue with that. So listen up -- Yaz is down but he won't be for long, so we need to start coming up with some answers. First of all--
What are you cheering about?!
What races?
Where are we?
You... can see the future.
Revenge?, For what?

Okay, someday you're gonna explain that to me, but right now you need to stop the riddles because there's about two minutes until Yaz crawls out of his hole and gets back to trying to kill you. So help me out. I need to know IN ENGLISH why Yaz is trying to kill you and what that has to do with saving the Earth.
You know what... he will know...
You know his plans.
And you're going to stop him. He wants to kill you because you stop him.
Okay, which future is the one where you live and the Earth doesn't blow up?
No! We need to get them home!
I knew Agent Kay wasn't just gonna lie down. So what's the plan?
Over there, Kay!

I know you're a little freaked out and you want to call for backup, but listen: When you've done this job for a while, you realize there's one rule -- things aren't what they seem. These are innocent beings that need our protection.
Good, good. What's your name?
He's gonna be better than OK. I'm not gonna give you so much shit anymore.
Be nice to him. Trust me.
Okay, you all wanted to go home.
That place is a dump anyway. Best Margaritas in the Universe, my ass.
Here, huh? You're sure?
I'll take that as a strong "yes."
Omaha. And I'm gonna buy you the biggest T-bone you ever saw when we get there. So -- you head over to the Omaha tube and I'm gonna help these guys over here for a second.
No, no, no. No way. Florida, Kay.
Don't you get it?
This is why you were there. In Florida. Because of them. You were helping them and that's why...
I just want you to know, I'm doing this out of love, man.
You stay home and stay alive.
Damn, you used to have some abs.
I can't let you go to Florida.
Bet you're sorry you taught me that.
You always lead with your--
I can't let you go -- I love you!
I'm not falling for that.
I have to know -- can I really prevent Kay's murder?
Oh. Okay, then. Thanks, good to hear.
What does that mean?
De-tube?
Thanks.
Kay? Archanans? Everyone OK?
Listen, your, uh...
Hey wait -- we can't help you get home, if you don't tell us how...
Whoa. So that's how you're getting home.
Okay. So we've got... 30 minutes to get past security. Get into Mission Control. Reprogram the flight path, pull the Astronauts off the launch and get them in that rocket.
Weird. I feel like I've been here.
Okay, I've got a plan to get through security. We just need to be invisible.
'Scuse me... I need to get inside... I've got the big man's Cadillac... all washed and ready to-
You've got it wrong, let me explain-
Finally, someone I can talk to--
Would it help if I told you I'm from the future?
Things change when you can see the future, right?
Attention, everyone! We've got a change in plans!
Hey! Attention over here! I need to talk to the man who can re-
Can anyone hear me? Hey! You in the glasses!
Slow down there! Everyone be cool!
No! Stop! Do not abort!
What's that? You been holding out on me?
Ha ha, just like old times...
Get under a--?
What the hell was that??
Catchy.
What the hell is wrong with you people? Raquel Welch comes by for a personal tour of Mission Control and you faint like a bunch of schoolgirls!
Five minutes to get to the rocket.
But we've got some bigger fish to fry. Hand over the flight suits.
Let's go, people. Why don't you take one giant leap out of there.
We good yet, Kay? I don't like being out here in the open -- too many ways for Yaz to get to you...
Oh, come on -- what's going on?
Oh, for...
Lift it. You have to lift it.
No, if I hold the lever, the rubber thingie won't... go in the thing where the thingie goes...
Because it's about to go down.
Nothing now.
Little something I brought with me.
That's a chance I'll have to take.
We did it, partner. I hope you remember this when you recruit me --
Yeah.
Do a better job this time, OK?
Thank you for your help, sir. Hope we don't get you fired.
Can I ask you -- what did the Lama show you in there that made you help us? Was it the Earth being destroyed?
Oh. Thanks. He's a lucky kid.
Okay...
But we'll make sure you're safe here. And the next rocket out...
No we didn't. You wanted to go home...
Gift? But we didn't get you home.
So then what's the gift?
This? Pong?
To make the missile defense system.
Hey. My watch stopped.
Yeah, I'll catch up with you in a second.

So you guys understand all this time stuff, right? So is everything going to be okay now? I mean, if I saved everything, and Yaz is really gone, why am I even here? Shouldn't I not have come in the first place? And why do I still have time left on my watch?
He didn't come yet! Kay, he didn't come yet!!!
Kay!
Where there is death, there will always be death. He saved your life. He swapped his for yours.
Leave me some memories this time,  OK?
Yes you will.
Noo!!!!
It's good to see you, man.
It's good to see you, man. So good. I just... do you remember...
No problem. You'd do the same for me. I just have one question...
When you disappeared... Why didn't I forget you when everyone else did?
Oh, you're talking about our closeness... you're talking about our love... Across timelines!
He was a good man.
I'm glad I know that.
Yep.
No.
I was very careful.
Excuse me?
Even I can't make that look good.
I was talking about the noodles.
Good evening, Mr. Wu.
Kay, Jay... So happy see you... Mr.
Not so fast, Wu. We'd like to take a look in the tanks.
Jay, take a look at this.
So this is what you're passing off as tuna?
I guess it would be.
If you were Chinese!
Aren't you forgetting something?
Yeah, look -- clean fork.
Come to think of it... Why is Wu getting our noodles... outside?
Oh, I know what happens next.
I've been waiting forty years for another shot at you, scum.
Damn!
They deserved what they got.
Will you settle for a drink?
Yaz. Put him away a long time ago.
No. Should've killed him.
That was too easy.
You don't get it, hoss. This guy is different. Worse than anyone.
Maybe.
Make sure you get all of him, I mean it! He's an assembler!
I know you do.
I used to play a game with my daddy. What would you want for your last meal. Could do worse than this.
Do me a favor, don't badmouth your old man.
I'm tired.
Petrified. See you later.
And slick? Watch yourself. A guy like Yaz can come after you when you least expect it. Anywhere, anytime.
What part of clean up everything don't you understand? There's a spleen on that car!
Yeah?
I'll take it from here.
Agent Kay, Division 2, special...
.black ops. Thank you for your cooperation, if I could ask you to look here for a moment --
That's got to be the first time an unregistered alien caught sneaking onto Earth was happy to see me.
If I had a partner I'd know it.
I'm all ears.
Well, thank you very much.
Yeah, thought I'd heard them all.
It sounds a LOT--
don't know what it's like on your planet, but around here, a guy with your... complexion in a car like that is gonna get some attention he doesn't want.
Twenty-six.
Here we go...
The Hamptons. Let's go somewhere we can talk.
"Subject uncooperative." Purpose of visit?
Save the Earth... Congratulations, you're the third one today... Maybe you'll get a balloon.
Are you currently pregnant or preparing to spawn?
Never heard of any Yaz.
Florida? I hate Florida. I hate everything South of Virginia. If that's what you came to tell me, you're wasting your time.
Huh. Well. This is finally starting to make sense.
Because you're crazy. Paranoia.
Hey, chief.
Actually, still trying to sort it out. He says he's human.
Got it, chief.
This little baby here is called a Neuralizer.
Have a lay down, stretch.
Don't worry. When it's over, you'll forget all about this Yaz and Florida and the end of the world. I think it'll be good for you. Calm you down.
Don't worry, it's safe. We even tested it on one of our own men.
Hey, Agent Q!
No, YOU'RE -- forget it.
We're still.., fine-tuning it.
Nice moves. You'd make a good agent.
You're just making it worse for yourself.
There's nowhere to run, slim. It's just if we're gonna do it easy or do it hard.
Bowling is enjoyed by more than 95 million people in more than 90 countries. You gotta do better than that.
How the hell do you know that?
If you're gonna drag her into this, you'd better be able to back up your story. Because if you're jerking me around, I'll make a window out of your head.
Alright, you're coming with me.
'Scuse me, boys. Just did a code 43 on this one.
You are a tourist from Kansas. A city slicker took your wallet at the bus station...
Two out.
You'd better not be wasting my time-
That's a hell of an observation.
We're going in.
Right.
Try not to get in my way.
What the hell is that?
The hell I will.
We've got something new. Portable Neuralizer.
Can you believe how small these things are getting?
Okay, slick. I'm making a decision to believe you. Not because I do, but because I have to, you get me?
Let's go get this sunovabitch.
Make it thirteen.
Now tell me everything you know about this Yaz scumbag.
Two days. Doesn't give me a lot of time. You couldn't have come back a week ago?
So we have two days to kill him before he kills me. Alright, there's one cesspool everyone washes up in sooner or later.
Well, I'got this whole dry ice thing.
No. We just can't figure out what it is.
Don't push your luck.
We need to talk.
Take it easy agent W, your cover is perfectly safe.
Cool your jets--
Yeah, I know they are, buddy. But you're doing good work here. We need you.
Maybe you know someone who's seen something.
C'mon, W, I got a feeling on this one. Like we should take it serious. And we don't have much time.
Start talking, you two, before you end up on a barber's floor.
Yeah?
You wanna play tough? How about we take a ride to the barber college, see how tough you are?
Then you're not worth much to us, are you?
What's the deal with the necklace?
That address. It's familiar.
I was going to come by here tomorrow to check out a lead on the dry ice case.
And Yaz kills me?
Aw, put on your big girl panties and let's go.
That thing back at the party, what was it? Some kind of game?
How do you know that?
Aw, what's the matter? Daddy didn't buy you the toy you wanted?
That's rough.
Why do you keep doing that?
Which must make them damn important. But what does he want with them?
And he's probably on their trail now. But where the hell did they go?
Looks like some kind of code.
So this is how you do it in the future, huh? You just keep guessing until you figure it out?
I don't know, but I'd bet you two to one Yaz sent her.
I think Yaz sent her.
I'd bet you two to one Yaz sent her.
I think I found them.
Yaz!
Let's get into trouble.
He's gone.
Hold that thought.
Don't you know if he's going to?
Alright, let's get these freaks home, and pronto.
That was someone else. All these mooners look alike, right?
But they're in danger. One of the most dangerous beings in the universe is out to kill them--
And if that happens, we're all going with them, because they're our only hope of survival.
I thought we were supposed to be the good guys.
It sounds like you need to cut some eyeholes in your stomach, because your head is so far up your ass, that's the only way you could possibly see.
Don't worry, we'll--
What?
You heard the man. We've got dry ice to investigate.
Just a few more questions about dry ice and I'll be out of your hair...
. Thanks, you've been very helpful.
Damn. Wrong freaks.
On your 2 o'clock.
Hold up.
Change in plans.
Yeah, Ex just gave us the new orders -- check this out --
You're gonna be okay, kid.
Where are we going?
Sounds good. See you there.
Omaha, my ass.
Let's go.
That's what it says.
Yeah, it's hot and muggy. The old people drive slow.
We'll stay somewhere air-
You know what an MiB agent calls it when he faces death? Besides I got you to watch my back, right?
Doing what?
I told them I'd help them -- I'm honor-bound to do it.
I make my own future! Besides --
Had enough yet?
Aw, hell, look at that-- behind you-
I'm not kidding --
Well, then. Better get started.
Good work. It's like we're not even here.
Little something I've been working on. Glasses if you've got 'em.
Oh, and you might want to get under a desk.
It's a high-velocity non-lethal pellet-gun. The boys in the lab call it the "hiv-nol-pog."
What a waste.
I'm almost there.
Hey, tech guys -- get back here and help me with the door.
Whatever, just get over here.
This door is complicated.
What? It's an Apollo rocket, not a Plymouth Valiant, OK? It's complicated.
No, I am lifting it. You have to hold the lever.
Jay... Why do you think a highly trained NASA technician would leave the back of his suit unzipped?
What's that?
Uh oh --
You know I will.
I guess we'll have to build a prison on the moon or something.
We're sorry we didn't get you home, guys. It was the only way to get rid of Yaz.
C'mon. Let's go watch that bastard leave the atmosphere.
See? I knew you had my back.
I'll take it from here.
Sure, partner. I'll see you around.
Hey, look -- your Dad wanted you to have this.
Your daddy had to go -- he's part of the space program, now. He's okay, he just had to take a trip up to the stars, but you'll be just fine. I'll keep an eye on you...
Alright, everyone, give me and my partner here a minute.
You mean, do I remember that you travelled back in time to save my life and the world? Not bad, slick. Not bad.
Well, I don't know exactly.
Yes he was.
So you travelled back in time, huh?
Wow. And you didn't change anything?
You're sure? Because the littlest thing can have huge repercussions.
Good man, good man. Well, let's get you a uniform.
foodstuffs.
Yaz guns the engine and BEARS DOWN ON KAY.
Your weapon is empty! Please recharge!
Sorry you're having trouble! If you survive this encounter, please call customer service at--
Yes, sir, Agent Kay.
On it, sir.
A glow of a cigarette illuminates the face of... Devil Girl!
Ready to bring the pain?
Where's Kay? We either roll or forfeit -- and I didn't put this on to forfeit!
trajectory and an ETA on those puppies.
Damn. Welp, looks like we're all done for. Sorry, kid, it's been a good ride.
Sure, great idea, if we had one.
I wanted to build one years ago, but Kay talked me out of it.
Detainees are on the tube to Toronto. No sign of Kay. Over.
This is my time to shine.
There goes my perfect game.
Ha ha ha.
We're number one! In your face!
Attention. Inbound missiles entering solar system! Inbound missiles entering solar system!
Running impact simulator...
Now running pan-galactic shield simulation.
Nine minutes to impact. I always loved you, microwave...
July in the city. A perfect summer day. Kids eat ice cream.
What are you talking about?
No way, man. I've just been here, totally legit, here in New Amsterdam. I mean -- Manahatta ... n I'm legit.
I swear, I'm out of that. That's my grandmother's.
Nothing, nothing man.
Family pet.
Oh, come on, man!
That's pirated, man. That ain't nothing.
No way, man. You don't mess with that guy. He'll kill you, me, and then he'll go after our families!
